japanese: トムとメアリーはジョンのパーティーに乱入した。
english: Tom and Mary crashed John's party.

japanese: ボストンみたいなところはないよ。
english: There's no place like Boston.

japanese: ボストンに勝る所なし。
english: There's no place like Boston.

japanese: ボストンが一番！
english: There's no place like Boston.

japanese: 君が聞いたことをトムに話してください。
english: Tell Tom what you heard.

japanese: 本社はボストンにあります。
english: Our main office is in Boston.

japanese: 弟はボストンに住んでいます。
english: My brother is living in Boston.

japanese: 兄はボストンに住んでいます。
english: My brother is living in Boston.

japanese: トムって呼んでもいい？
english: May I call you Tom?

japanese: トムに必ず伝えてよ。
english: Make sure you tell Tom.

japanese: パーク通りの新しい中華料理屋に行こうよ。
english: Let's go to the new Chinese restaurant on Park Street.

japanese: 今日ボストンは３６度でした。
english: It was 36 degrees in Boston today.

japanese: トムはヒルトンホテルに泊まってるんですか？
english: Is Tom staying at the Hilton Hotel?

japanese: あれがトムの欲しいやつなの？
english: Is that what Tom wants?

japanese: ボストンはここから遠いの？
english: Is it far from here to Boston?

japanese: ボストンって、めちゃ遠い？
english: Is Boston very far away?

japanese: ボストンは、すごく遠いですか？
english: Is Boston very far away?

japanese: ボストンは遠いんですか？
english: Is Boston far away?

japanese: ボストンには何回も行ったことがあります。
english: I've been to Boston many times.

japanese: 明日、ボストンに行くんです。
english: I'm going to Boston tomorrow.

japanese: ボストンに着いたらすぐ電話します。
english: I'll call you as soon as I get to Boston.

japanese: ボストンにはいつか行ってみたいと思ってます。
english: I'd like to visit Boston someday.

japanese: 僕はボストンで育ちました。
english: I was raised in Boston.

japanese: ボストンはとても美しい街だと思う。
english: I think Boston is very beautiful.

japanese: ボストンで道に迷ったんだ。
english: I lost my way in Boston.

japanese: トムがボストンに行ったの知ってるよ。
english: I know that Tom went to Boston.

japanese: ハーバード大学を卒業しました。
english: I graduated from Harvard.

japanese: 先月ボストンに来ました。
english: I came to Boston last month.

japanese: トムはどれくらいボストンに住んでいますか？
english: How long has Tom lived in Boston?

japanese: どうして僕がボストン出身だって分かったの？
english: How did you know I was from Boston?

japanese: ボストンには行ったことある？
english: Have you ever visited Boston?

japanese: ボストンは好きですか？
english: Do you like Boston?

japanese: あなたたちはボストンの写真がある？
english: Do you have any pictures of Boston?

japanese: ボストンの地図はあるの？
english: Do you have a map of Boston?

japanese: 私はトムと一緒に行くことができますか。
english: Can I go with Tom?

japanese: ボストンには長く滞在する予定なんですか？
english: Are you planning on staying in Boston for a long time?

japanese: 来週はボストンに行く予定なの？
english: Are you going to go to Boston next week?

japanese: ボストンから来たんですか？
english: Are you from Boston?

japanese: ボストンのご出身ですか？
english: Are you from Boston?

japanese: 今度の週末、ボストンに来るの？
english: Are you coming to Boston this weekend?

japanese: ボストンには高いビルがたくさんある？
english: Are there a lot of tall buildings in Boston?

japanese: 一人いくらですか？
english: How much is it for one person?

japanese: 誰か修正液持ってない？
english: Does anyone have some liquid paper?

japanese: 今年の梅雨は長引きそうですね。
english: This year's rainy season is going to be a long one.

japanese: 手繋いでいい？
english: May I hold your hand?

japanese: おかけになった電話番号は現在使われておりません。
english: The number you have called is not in service.

japanese: 誰も言ってくれないなら、僕が何回でも、何百回でも言ってあげるよ、生きててくれてありがとうって。
english: If no one else will say it, then I'll say it as many times as you need to hear it. Thank you for living.

japanese: がっかりさせてごめんなさい。
english: I'm sorry I disappointed you.

japanese: お笑いのセンスがあるね。いいね。
english: You have a sense of humour. I like that.

japanese: 笑いのツボをおさえてるね。いいね。
english: You have a sense of humour. I like that.

japanese: すみません、そこ私の席だと思うんですけど。
english: Excuse me, but I believe that is my seat.

japanese: ドイツに飛びます。
english: I'll be flying to Germany.

japanese: この写真は３年前のものだよ。
english: This picture is from three years ago.

japanese: 牛乳は残ってる？
english: Is there any milk left?

japanese: お会計は1Fレジにてお願い致します。
english: Please pay the bill at the first floor register.

japanese: 人の恋愛に首突っ込んでこないでよ。
english: Don't interfere in other people's relationships.

japanese: 外は雪だよ。
english: It's snowing outside.

japanese: 外は雪が降ってるよ。
english: It's snowing outside.

japanese: 「終電逃したらどうしよう」「帰れなかったらうち泊めてやるよ」
english: "What should I do if I miss the last train?" "If you aren't able to get back home then you can stay here."

japanese: 「終電逃したらどうしよう？」「ネカフェかどっかで朝まで過ごすか」
english: "What will we do if we miss the last train?" "How about waiting until morning at an internet café or somewhere else?"

japanese: 未精算商品のトイレへのお持ち込みはご遠慮いただいております。
english: Please do not bring unpaid goods into the toilet.

japanese: 誰か鉛筆持ってる？
english: Do any of you have a pencil?

japanese: 誰か鉛筆持ってない？
english: Does anybody have a pencil?

japanese: どなたか鉛筆をお持ちではないでしょうか？
english: Does anybody have a pencil?

japanese: みんな鉛筆持ってる？
english: Does everybody have a pencil?

japanese: みんな鉛筆はある？
english: Does everybody have a pencil?

japanese: みなさん鉛筆はお持ちでしょうか？
english: Does everybody have a pencil?

japanese: すいません、忘れました。
english: I'm sorry. I forgot.

japanese: 「私のこと愛してる？」「どうかな？」
english: "Do you love me?" "I don't know."

japanese: 「私のこと愛してる？」「さあね」
english: "Do you love me?" "I don't know."

japanese: 私ができるんなら、あなただってできるわ。
english: If I can do it, so can you.

japanese: 靴下が3足欲しい。
english: I want three pairs of socks.

japanese: 紙・鉛筆・インクとか要るんですが。
english: I need some paper, pencils, ink and so on.

japanese: 細部に至るまで全てが完璧だった。
english: Everything was perfect, down to the smallest detail.

japanese: 明日は何時に着くの？
english: What time do you arrive tomorrow?

japanese: メアリーは来られないよ。娘さんの面倒を見なくてはいけないんだ。
english: Mary can't come. She has to take care of her daughter.

japanese: スキージャンプって、見るからに怖いよな。
english: Ski jumping looks scary.

japanese: 何かしようとしたんだけど何しようとしたんだっけ？
english: I tried to do something, but what was it?

japanese: 寝タバコはご遠慮ください。
english: Don't smoke in bed.

japanese: 今日は家にいるつもりよ。
english: We're going to stay at home today.

japanese: このこと、話した方が良さそうね。
english: I think I should talk about this.

japanese: トムはメアリーが自分にやって欲しいことをちゃんと理解した。
english: Tom understood exactly what Mary wanted him to do.

japanese: 料理人を見た。
english: I saw the cook.

japanese: なんて？ごめん、考え事してた。
english: What did you say? I'm sorry, I was lost in thought.

japanese: トムは自転車事故に遭った。
english: Tom was in a bicycle accident.

japanese: あの子の笑顔が忘れられない。
english: I can't forget her smile.

japanese: 「やばい、電池切れそう」「寝てる間に充電しとけばよかったのに」
english: “Yikes, my battery’s nearly dead.” “You should have charged it overnight while you were sleeping.”

japanese: トムのうるさいいびきで一睡もできなかった。
english: Tom's loud snoring kept me awake all night.

japanese: その湖は深いんですか？
english: Is the lake deep?

japanese: この湖は深いんですか？
english: Is this lake deep?

japanese: トムは、一体どうしちゃったんだ？
english: What's wrong with Tom?

japanese: トムは楽しんだ。
english: Tom had fun.

japanese: 君はトムに何が起こったか聞いた？
english: Did you hear about what's happened to Tom?

japanese: すべてがトムの予言通りに進んでいる。
english: Everything is working out just as Tom predicted.

japanese: 誰かが僕のカップケーキ全部食べちゃった。
english: Someone ate all my cupcakes.

japanese: トムとメアリーは交際一周年を記念して、ロマンチックなディナーをとった。
english: Tom and Mary had a romantic dinner to celebrate the first anniversary of their being together.

japanese: トムはメアリーがつけている結婚指輪に気づいた。
english: Tom noticed a wedding ring on Mary's finger.

japanese: トムはそう遠くへは行っていないはずだ。
english: Tom can't have gone very far.

japanese: うまくいくよう祈ってて。
english: Keep your fingers crossed.

japanese: この政策の是非については専門家の間でも意見が分かれている。
english: Opinions on the strengths and weaknesses of this policy differ even between specialists.

japanese: 雪で電車が遅延していてまだ家に帰れてません。
english: The train has been delayed because of the snow and I haven't been able to get home yet.

japanese: 「今年はホワイトクリスマスになるといいね」「そうだね」
english: "I hope we have a white Christmas this year." "Yeah."

japanese: トムは3年前階段で転んで骨を折った。
english: 3 years ago, Tom fell down the stairs and broke his bones.

japanese: それ以来カナダとイランの国交は断絶している。
english: Since then, diplomatic relations between Canada and Iran have been suspended.

japanese: 戦争が始まったとき、トムはボストンにいた。
english: Tom was in Boston when the war began.

japanese: トムは今にも泣き出しそうな顔をしていた。
english: Tom looked as if he was about to burst out crying at any time.

japanese: 「これは1ですか、7ですか？」「いや、2のつもりなんですけど」
english: "Is that a 1 or a 7?" "Neither. It's supposed to be a 2."

japanese: 誰がその噂を広めたんだ？
english: Who spread that rumor?

japanese: その噂を流したのは誰だ？
english: Who spread that rumor?

japanese: 誰が、床に牛乳をこぼしたの？
english: Who spilled the milk on the floor?

japanese: 床にミルクをこぼしたのは誰？
english: Who spilled the milk on the floor?

japanese: 火元はなに？
english: What started the fire?

japanese: 出火原因は何ですか？
english: What started the fire?

japanese: 僕らは南フランスを旅した。
english: We traveled through the south of France.

japanese: 私たちは南フランスを訪ね歩いた。
english: We traveled through the south of France.

japanese: 無理そう。
english: It sounds impossible.

japanese: 荷物が置ける場所はありますか？
english: Is there any space for my luggage?

japanese: 不味かったら、出してね。
english: If it tastes bad, spit it out.

japanese: トムがスパイだなんて、私は信じないもん。
english: I don't believe Tom is a spy.

japanese: 一体いつになったら春が来るんだろう。
english: When on earth will spring come?

japanese: 少し考えさせて。
english: Let me think it over a bit.

japanese: ちょっと迷っちゃって。心配かけてごめんね。
english: I got a bit lost. Sorry to have worried you.

japanese: こんな寒い日に出かけるの？ やめといた方がいいんじゃない？
english: Are you really going to go out on such a cold day? Why don’t you reconsider?

japanese: 何かあったら相談してね。できる範囲で力になるから。
english: If anything happens then you can talk to me about it. I'll help as much as I can.

japanese: もうちょい痩せないと今まで穿いてたジーパンがきつい。
english: If I don't slim down now, the jeans I fit into will be too tight.

japanese: あんまり考えすぎないでね。人生まだまだ長いんだし。
english: Don’t worry about it too much. You’ve still got such a long life ahead of you.

japanese: 2時になったら寝るね。
english: Once it hits two o'clock, I'll go to bed.

japanese: 明日早いからそろそろ寝よっかな。
english: I start early tomorrow, maybe I should go to sleep soon.

japanese: ただ今電話が混み合っております。ご迷惑をおかけいたしますが、もうしばらくお待ちください。
english: All of our phone lines are currently busy. We apologize for the inconvenience but kindly ask that you wait a little longer.

japanese: トムは高くジャンプしてボールを取った。
english: Tom jumped high and caught the ball.

japanese: 長い闘病生活の末、夫が亡くなりました。
english: My husband passed away after having fought against his illness for a long time.

japanese: 俺の青春を返せ！
english: Give me back my youth!

japanese: トムは法廷に出頭を命じられた。
english: Tom was ordered to go to the court of law.

japanese: 「荷物持とうか？」「いいよ、大丈夫。ありがとう」
english: "Shall I carry your bags?" "I'm good, thank you."

japanese: お前さぁ、どうしてそんなことしたの？
english: Why did you do that, my friend?

japanese: 毛をそると、さらに濃くなるよ。
english: If you shave your hair, it will grow back thicker.

japanese: 彼女、きっと気に入るよ。
english: I'm sure she'll like it.

japanese: トムはこのワイン気に入ると思うよ。
english: I think Tom will like this wine.

japanese: もっと水を飲みなさい。
english: Drink more water.

japanese: 深く潜れば潜るほど、水は冷たくなった。
english: The deeper we dived, the colder the water got.

japanese: 期待に応えられなくてごめんなさい。
english: I'm sorry that I couldn't live up to your expectations.

japanese: ご期待に添えず申し訳ございませんでした。
english: I’m sorry I couldn't meet your expectations.

japanese: 今日は雪で休校になったので一日中家でごろごろしてました。
english: Because my school was closed yesterday due to the snow, I hung out all day at home.

japanese: 昨日は間違いなく私の30年の人生で最悪の日でした。
english: Yesterday was, without a doubt, the worst day of my thirty years of life.

japanese: サーバーへの接続に失敗しました。ネットワーク設定を確認してください。
english: Failed to connect to server. Please check your network settings.

japanese: お二人さま、ありがとう。
english: Thanks to both of you.

japanese: 「なんで怒ってるの？」「怒ってません！」
english: "Why are you mad at me?" "I'm not mad at you!"

japanese: 「何を隠そうとしてるんだよ」「何も」
english: "What are you trying to hide?" "Nothing."

japanese: どうして避けてるの？
english: Why are you avoiding me?

japanese: 3歳になったばかりの息子がいます。
english: I have a son who's just turned three.

japanese: 犯人はカナダ人の男だった。
english: The culprit was a Canadian man.

japanese: 母は高校の先生です。
english: My mother is a high school teacher.

japanese: 父は中学校で英語を教えています。
english: My father teaches English at a middle school.

japanese: 私が20歳になったばかりの頃、父が脳梗塞で入院しました。
english: When I had only just entered my 20's, my father was admitted to hospital due to a stroke.

japanese: すみません、ここってこの地図でいうとどの辺でしょうか？
english: Excuse me, where am I on this map?

japanese: トムには3歳になったばかりの息子がいる。
english: Tom has a son who's just turned three.

japanese: おじいさんがあそこに一人で住んでいる。
english: A lonely old man lives there.

japanese: 家からそう遠くないところに小さな映画館があって、前から気になっていたので先日初めて行ってみました。
english: There’s a small movie theater not too far from my house which I had been meaning to check out for a while, so the other day I went there for the first time.

japanese: 留学先をオーストラリアにするかカナダにするかで迷っています。
english: I'm not sure whether I should go study abroad in Australia or Canada.

japanese: ごめんね、めんどくさいやつで。本当はこんなこと誰にも言わずにいるべきなんだけど。
english: Sorry, he is a troublesome bloke. I shouldn't really be saying these things to people though.

japanese: 二度と私のものに触らないで。
english: Don't ever touch my things again.

japanese: 学生時代に夢中になっていたことはありますか？
english: When you were a student were you ever completely engrossed in something?

japanese: トムのことあんなに好きだったのに、あの気持ちはどこに行っちゃったんだろう。
english: I used to like Tom so much, I wonder what happened to that feeling.

japanese: 私は彼が私の事を好きだと思う。
english: I guess he really loves me.

japanese: 私は彼女が私のことを好きだと思う。
english: I guess she really loves me.

japanese: 友達がいる必要がありますか？
english: Does this require me to have friends?

japanese: その日、朝から降り出した雨は町に灯りがつく頃ふとやみそうだったが、夜になると急にまた土砂降りになった。
english: That day, the rain that had been falling since morning seemed as if it was about to stop around the time that the streetlamps are lit, but as night came it suddenly turned into pouring rain.

japanese: 夜更けのせいか、雨のせいか、人影はなかった。
english: I don't know if it was because of the late hour or because of the rain, but there was no one around.

japanese: 「……追われているわけでもないんだな」 　そう呟いた途端、角の家の門灯がすっと消えた。 　雨はますます激しくなってきた……。
english: "You're not being chased, are you?" Just as he said that in a quiet voice, the corner house's light went out. The rain became more intense...

japanese: 何はともあれ、小沢は着ていたレインコートをあわてて脱いだ。 そして、娘の裸の体へぱっと着せてやった。
english: At any rate, Ozawa hurriedly took off his raincoat and quickly put it on the naked girl's shoulders.

japanese: 小沢は外地から復員して、今夜やっと故郷の大阪へ帰って来たばかしだが、終戦後の都会や近郊の辻強盗の噂は、汽車の中できいて知っていた。
english: Ozawa had been demobilized from overseas and had just arrived this night into his hometown, Osaka, but he had heard rumors on the train about bandits roaming in the postwar cities and suburbs.

japanese: 暗がりではっきり見えなかったが、娘の顔が半泣きらしいことは声で判った。
english: He could not see well in the dark, but from the sound of her voice he could tell that the girl was on the verge of tears.

japanese: 夜分遅くにすみません。
english: I'm sorry to call you so late at night.

japanese: 小沢は朝から――というより、昨夜から何も食べていなかった。
english: Ozawa had not eaten anything since morning, or rather since the previous night.

japanese: 男はにやりと笑うと、勘定を払った。そしてコップに残っているビールを、立ったまま、ぐいと飲みほした。
english: The man grinned widely and stood up. He then paid the bill and emptied his glass of beer in one gulp.

japanese: 私は体罰には断固反対です。
english: I'm firmly opposed to corporal punishment.

japanese: 何時にどこで会える？
english: When and where shall we meet?

japanese: トムに出会えて本当によかった。
english: I'm really glad that I was able to meet Tom.

japanese: どうせ私なんてこの世界には必要ないんだ。
english: This world doesn't need me anyway.

japanese: トムは大きな家で一人暮らしをしている。
english: Tom lives alone in a big house.

japanese: トムは石油で財を成した。
english: Tom made a fortune in oil.

japanese: ここから海岸までは大体3kmくらいです。
english: From here, it's about three kilometers to the coast.

japanese: トムは何を着てもかっこいい。
english: No matter what Tom wears, he looks cool.

japanese: かわいい人は何を着てもかわいい。
english: A cute person will look cute no matter what they wear.

japanese: 「そのトムって人、変人なの？」「変人ってわけじゃないんだけど、なんというか、すごく個性的なんだよ」
english: "This Tom guy, is he some kind of weirdo?" "I wouldn't say he's a weirdo. He's just...very unique."

japanese: 来月で30歳になります。本当に充実した20代でした。
english: I turn 30 next month. My 20's have been really fulfilling.

japanese: 実は元彼とより戻すことになったんだ。
english: As a matter of fact, I've gotten back with my old boyfriend.

japanese: 「トムはなんでトムっていうの？ 本名じゃないんだよね？」「うん。本名は智也っていうんだけど、トモヤがトモになって、トモがトムになったんだ」
english: "Why are you called Tom? It's not your real name, right?" "Right. My real name is Tomoya, but then Tomoya became Tomo, which then became Tom."

japanese: 「またトムから電話？」「うん。このところ毎晩かかってくるの。番号教えるんじゃなかった」
english: "Is that Tom calling again?" "Yes. He calls every evening these days. I shouldn't have given him my number."

japanese: あちこち旅してるからなあ。
english: I travel around a lot.

japanese: デートしませんか？
english: Will you go on a date with me?

japanese: 一緒にダイエットしない？
english: Do you want to go on a diet with me?

japanese: 今度一緒にカラオケ行かない？
english: Do you want to go to karaoke together sometime?
